newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-BAGGIO SEALS 4-2 WIN FOR MILAN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BAGGIO SEALS 4-2 WIN FOR MILAN.

text.p: Substitute Roberto Baggio scored a last-minute goal for AC Milan on Wednesday as the Italian champions beat Sweden's IFK Gothenburg 4-2 in their do-or-die Champions' League group D match.
Milan, beaten in two of their three matches to date, desperately needed to beat Gothenburg to stave off an early exit from the competition they have won five times.

The home team took the lead after just three minutes through Croat Zvonimir Boban and then went 2-0 up after another 10 minutes. Demetrio Albertini converted a penalty after Marco Simone had been felled by Mikael Nilsson.

Gothenburg, who beat Milan 2-1 two weeks ago, replied when unmarked Jesper Blomqvist slotted home in the 26th minute. Then Andreas Andersson equalised in the 32nd in a goalmouth scramble following a corner.
Milan regained the lead when Simone crossed from the right and Tomas Locatelli fired home.

Both teams had their chances in the second half but the decisive move only came after Italy's 1994 World Cup star Baggio came on as a substitute in the 63rd minute, and scored his last-gasp goal from close range.
